sentence.Network_en: The hospital blamed the mix-up on a clerical error.

sentence.Network_cn: 只是下级办事员还嫌薄弱.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late 15th cent. (in sense 2): from ecclesiastical Latin clericalis, from clericus 'clergyman' (see cleric)

entry.tran: 文书工作的;文职人员的
entry.def: Clerical jobs, skills, and workers are concerned with work that is done in an office.

example.ex: ...a strike by clerical staff in all government departments...
example.tran: 所有政府部门的文员举行的罢工

example.ex: The hospital blamed the mix-up on a clerical error.
example.tran: 医院方面将这一混乱归咎于一处笔误。

entry.tran: 神职人员的;圣职人员的
entry.def: Clerical means relating to the clergy.

example.ex: ...a bearded man in a dark suit and clerical collar.
example.tran: 身穿黑西装，脖子上围着教士领的蓄着络腮胡子的男人

means.word_mean: 2. of or relating to the clergy;
3. appropriate for or engaged in office work;
